comments_since_last_sample.body: The only people you will convince with this video are the ones like me that are already fully aware. If you want to reach a wider audience you should show the impact on 1st world countries.

The melting of all the ice from global warming will dilute the oceans and make it less acidic than it is. This will make the oceans more conducive to marine life, returning it to an older time when the oceans were a lot more healthy. Healthy oceans mean more seafood.  So, embrace global warming, it’s not so bad. A couple more sweaty days a year is a small price to pay for rehabilitating our oceans.

The climate is changing but its not warming and its not caused by human generated CO2... its cooling and its caused by the sun going into a grand solar minimum which is a natural 400 year solar cycle where the suns magnetosphere weakens which causes our planet and the rest of the surrounding planets magneto-spheres to weaken too which alters our weather patterns...the last time  this happened was in the mid 1600's and lasted approx 70 years... the earth generally cooled and we had longer colder harsher more snowy winters, extremely wet spring and autumns causing flooding and generally shorter and hotter summers... another side effect of the grand solar minimum is more volcano's become more active due to the suns cosmic rays penetrating the earth through the weakened protective magnetosphere... so pretty much the same as whats currently happening now and increasing over the next 5-10 years when we'll be in the midst of the grand solar minimum
